pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
meanings: going to work (e.g. in the morning)

related.meaning: advance (into a new market, industry, etc.)
appearance (in a film, play, TV show, etc.)

lessons.japanese: 彼は今日は気分が悪いため出社できません。
lessons.english: He cannot come to the office today as he is indisposed.

lessons.japanese: 彼は今日は気分が悪いため出社できません。
lessons.english: Since he doesn't feel well today, he can't come to the office.

lessons.japanese: 彼は今日は気分が悪いため出社できません。
lessons.english: He can't come to the office today because he doesn't feel well.

lessons.japanese: 彼は５週間ぶりに出社した。
lessons.english: He went to his office after an absence of five weeks.

lessons.japanese: 日曜日に出社したので月曜日が代休だった。
lessons.english: I worked on Sunday, so I had Monday off.

lessons.japanese: 土曜日には出社する必要がありません。
lessons.english: You need not come to the office on Saturdays.

lessons.japanese: 出社したら仕事がたくさんあって、アタフタした。
lessons.english: When I got to the office, I had tons of work waiting for me. I was running around like a chicken with its head cut off.

lessons.japanese: 社長はマイクが就業時間に出社しないので彼を首にした。
lessons.english: The boss gave Mike the ax for not coming to work on time.

lessons.japanese: 兄は出社前に新聞にざっと目を通すことが習慣になっている。
lessons.english: My brother makes it a rule to look over the newspaper before going to his office.

lessons.japanese: 兄は出社前に新聞にざっと目を通すことが習慣になっている。
lessons.english: My brother makes it a rule to look over the newspaper before going to his office.

lessons.japanese: 毎朝９時に出社しています。
lessons.english: I report to work at 9 o'clock every morning.

lessons.japanese: 社長はマイクが就業時間に出社しないので彼を首にした。
lessons.english: The boss gave Mike the ax for not coming to work on time.

lessons.japanese: 出社したら仕事がたくさんあって、アタフタした。
lessons.english: When I got to the office, I had tons of work waiting for me. I was running around like a chicken with its head cut off.

lessons.japanese: 土曜日には出社する必要がありません。
lessons.english: You need not come to the office on Saturdays.

lessons.japanese: 日曜日に出社したので月曜日が代休だった。
lessons.english: I worked on Sunday, so I had Monday off.
